subject_terms_3: Portrait photography Teachers Youth Chinese Girls' School
physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a large group of people. The majority of them are children while a minority are adults, who are standing at the back. There is  a mixture of male and female children in the photograph. Everyone is looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured.
sgcool_label_text:
This photograph shows a group of girls from Singapore Chinese Girls School and older women, who may possibly be school teachers. 

Singapore Chinese Girlsâ€™ School was established on Hill Street in July 1899. Starting with a class of just seven students, the school did not initially enjoy the support of senior members of the Peranakan community who did not believe in female education. Led by Lim Boon Keng and Song Ong Siang, the group of younger Peranakans were determined to establish a school for girls which offered a modern curriculum based on Confucian values.
title_text: Photograph of students from Singapore Chinese Girls School
subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Portraits, Group Portrait photography Students Teachers Singapore Chinese Girls' School
